definition: glittering jewels
gem
(gem)/tinkling of pendants
jade-like stone/clean and white/tinkling of pendants
see 瑯琊山|琅玡山[Lang2 ya2 Shan1]
glittering jewels to delight the eye (idiom)/fig. a dazzling lineup
lit. to fill one's eyes with glittering jewels/a literary masterpiece or sb of extraordinary talent (idiom)

sentences.english: A long thin table against the front wall was covered with gorgeous jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 而靠墙的一条长桌上则摆满了琳琅满目的首饰。

sentences.english: The market in the port:There are many small wares loaded to here by ship.
sentences.chinese: 口岸市场》口岸市场里琳琅满目的舶来小商品。

sentences.english: Shop windows display of goods dazzling, brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 商店的橱窗里陈列的商品琳琅满目，熠熠生辉。

sentences.english: Tiny street-side market stalls replaced trinket-laden shop windows.
sentences.chinese: 小小的街边货摊代替了货物琳琅满目的商店橱窗。

sentences.english: His visitor was shown into the study, where all the fishing tackle hung.
sentences.chinese: 客人给请进了书房，那里各种钓鱼用具挂得琳琅满目。

sentences.english: A: The shop is a feast for the eyes indeed.
sentences.chinese: 你们店实在是琳琅满目，美不胜收。

definition: Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
pearls and jades/jewels/clever remark/beautiful writing/gems of wisdom/genius/outstanding person
lit. to fill one's eyes with glittering jewels/a literary masterpiece or sb of extraordinary talent (idiom)
beautiful/sweet/engaging
gold and jade/precious
clear and soft (voice)
fills the eyes (of a beautiful view, scene of desolation etc)
beautiful silk fabrics/person in beautiful silk dress
dust fall/fallout (volcanic, nuclear etc)/particulate matter
to swirl about/(of leaves and branches) to sway
firefly
(onom.) clink of jewels/exquisite/detailed and fine/clever/nimble
bluish-green/green jade
to regret leaving/reluctant to part/(onom.) young leaves stir gently in the wind
beautiful/graceful
a rare treasure/sth priceless and unique
